con:part.con:content:
<wsdl:definitions name="PersonService" targetNamespace="http://person.ws.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="http://person.ws.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:ns1="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"> <wsdl:documentation>The Chrome River Person Web Service fulfills requests from our customers to create/update/delete person records, as well as add/remove person-entity relationships in the Chrome River system.
To get started with Person Web Service, please submit a Chrome River Help Desk ticket. Our Implementation team will work with you to get everything set up and running.
To access this service, use this Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file to generate the required client proxy classes: https://api.chromeriver.com/ws_PersonV1?wsdl
Please also read this documentation to understand what it does and how to properly prepare requests.
Logging In
Each request to access this service must be authenticated via either login credentials or a session token. The Login Web Service may be used to submit the user's login information in a request consisting of companyID, userID, and password. The user will receive a token to submit with subsequent requests to other Chrome River Web Services, eliminating the need to provide the login information again.
While it is also possible to submit login information directly via the header of the Person Web Service, it is recommended that customers use the Login Web Service first to obtain a session token, and then submit this token in each subsequent request to the Person Service.
Chrome River Person Web Service Overview
Please use the following description as a reference, but do not hesitate to contact us at support@chromeriver.com should you run into problems or have questions.
There are eight operations exposed via the Person Web Service: createPerson, updatePerson, deletePerson, addEntity, removeEntity, addPersonDelegate, deletePersonDelegate and getPersonDetails. Each call to createPerson or udpatePerson or deletePerson either creates or updates or deletes a single person record in the Chrome River system for the requesting customer. Each call to addEntity or removeEntity either adds or removes a single person-entity association in the Chrome River system for the requesting customer. Each call to addPersonDelegate adds a new delegate for the person or updates it, if it exists, deletePersonDelegate removes a person-delegate relationship. Calling getPersonDetails with a customerUniqueId as input will return information about the corresponding person or a validation error (code 501) to indicate no such person exists. More specifically, if the person exists in our system, a Person object is returned (as the webServicePayload value of the envelope; see below), the same type (with the same fields) as the Person input to the create/update operations that are documented below.
Each call to one of the first seven operations (createPerson, updatePerson, deletePerson, addEntity, removeEntity, addPersonDelegate and deletePersonDelegate) requires two input objects: the LoginCredentials object and the Person, PersonDelegate or Entity object or Customer Unique ID, depending on the operation. The former contains either the full login information or a session token, while the latter contains input parameter values (those that are optional may be omitted) required to complete the request. The eighth operation (getPersonDetails) expects the same LoginCredentials object and a string representing the customer unique ID to be queried against.
The service responds to a request with the MessageEnvelope object. In the event of a successful outcome, the envelope will contain the statusCode "ReturnStatusCode.SUCCESS." In the event of a failed outcome, the envelope will contain the statusCode "ReturnStatusCode.FAIL," along with a list of ValidationError objects detailing why the request was not completed successfully.
Each ValidationError contains three pieces of information: the error code, the name of the error code, and a brief message explaining the error. For example, in a createPerson request, if the incoming customerUniqueID already points to an existing person in our system, the response envelope will contain the ValidationError with error code "500," the name "ObjectExists," and the message "Person with customerUniqueID jdoe already exists." (In this case, "jdoe" is the customerUniqueID submitted in the request.)
It is recommended that each error message be processed, the input be corrected, and the request be retried at a later time. Also note that each request is first authenticated before further processing, so that if the token or the login credentials are not valid, only a "9000/InvalidLogin" error or a "9001/InvalidSession" error will be returned in the response. For more information about login errors, please see the WSDL documentation for the Login Web Service.
For the createPerson and updatePerson operations, not all of the parameters for the input Person object are required in all cases. If a parameter is not required, it may be omitted from the request. In such a case, it will take on the default value (null/empty value, unless otherwise specified) in our system in a createPerson call. In an updatePerson call, behaviour should be as mentioned below: 1. If a tag is not present, the corresponding value will not be updated in our system. 2. If a tag is present with no value, the corresponding value will be removed. 3. If a tag exists with new value, the corresponding value will be updated.
It is important to note that even when a parameter is required in a create call, if it is not required in an update call, it is marked as optional in the WSDL. Use the validation rules described below to ensure no wrong assumptions are made in these cases (if a field is not documented as being required, then it is optional).
One final note before we list the parameters and validation rules for this Web Service. Even though each person has his/her own password and email format (HTML or text) settings, these cannot be set via the Person Web Service. Instead, in a createPerson call these are initialized to the default password and email format setup for the customer. To change these please ask somebody in your company who has admin access to change them in the People Admin screen.
Person Web Service - Parameters and Validation Rules
Here are validation rules for the createPerson / updatePerson / deletePerson operations that are unrelated to the fields of the input Person object.
========= Constraint: the createPerson and updatePerson operations currently only support customers in Analytics Phase 1. Violation: one of these operations is called for a customer not in Analytics Phase 1. Error: 50/AnalyticsPhaseNotSupported ========= Constraint: the Person record has the DND flag set to true, which indicates updates/deletes are not allowed on this record via the Person Web Service or the Person Feed Violation: updatePerson is called on a person with this flag set to true Error: 502/ObjectLocked ========= Constraint: the Person record has the isModifiable flag set to false, which indicates updates are not allowed on this record Violation: updatePerson is called on a person with this flag set to true Error: 502/ObjectLocked =========
Here are the parameters of the input Person object for the createPerson / updatePerson / deletePerson operations and associated validation rules. Note the getPersonDetails operation returns the same Person object as described here.
========= Field: customerUniqueID Description: person's unique record identifier. --- Constraint: in createPerson call, must not refer to an existing person Violation: input value refers to an existing person Error: 500/ObjectExists --- Constraint: in updatePerson call, must refer to an existing person Violation: input value does not refer to an existing person Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: in deletePerson call, must refer to an existing person Violation: input value does not refer to an existing person Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: max length is 100 Violation: input value is over 100 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength ========= Field: firstName/lastName/username Description: person's first name/last name/unique identifier used for login --- Constraint: required in createPerson call Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: optional in updatePerson call, but must not specify empty string Violation: input value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: max length is 50 Violation: input value is over 50 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength --- [username only] Constraint: must be unique, i.e. not conflict with another username for the customer Violation: another person with the given username already exists Error: 3000/ChoiceUnavailable ========= Field: reportsTo Description: person UniqueID for direct reporting used for business rules Note: in an update call, send the empty string to reset reportsTo to null (reports to no one) --- Constraint: value must be a valid customerUniqueID for the customer Violation: value is not a valid customerUniqueID for the customer Error: 2003/InvalidPersonCode --- Constraint: in a createPerson call, may not set self as reportsTo Violation: value equals customerUniqueID in a createPerson call Error: 1007/InvalidOption Note: to set self as reportsTo, use the updatePerson operation ========= Field: emailAddress Description: unique email address for the person --- Constraint: required in createPerson call Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: optional in updatePerson call, but must not specify empty string Violation: input value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: max length is 100 Violation: input value is over 100 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength --- Constraint: must be a valid email address Violation: not a valid email address Error: 1006/InvalidEmail --- Constraint: must be unique, i.e. not conflict with another email address in our database Violation: another person with the given email already exists Error: 3000/ChoiceUnavailable ========= Field: active Description: indicates if this person is active in our system; defaults to true Note: for customers who have used our Person Feed process: in a createPerson call, true maps to the person status of 1 (pending) while false maps to 4 (deleted); in an updatePerson call, true reverts status back to 1 if the current status is 4 but does not update the status if the current status is 1 or 2 (active); finally, in an updatePerson call, false maps to the status of 4. ========= Field: title Description: title of person --- Constraint: max length is 255 Violation: input value is over 255 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength ========= Field: entity1/entity2/entity3 Description: Assigns person to a customer's defined Entity structure. Must map to customer's EntityType that must be setup first. --- Constraint: customer account must be setup to handle input value for each of these fields Violation: customer account not setup to handle entityN (N=1, 2, or 3) Error: 1007/InvalidOption --- Constraint: the input value must refer to a valid entity code under the entity type setup in the customer account Violation: input value is not a valid entity Error: 2004/InvalidEntityCode ========= Field: currencyCode1 Description: currency code of the Accounts Payable Vendor 1; format: ISO-4217 as supported by www.xe.com Note: if omitted in a create call or sending an empty string in an update call, set currencyCode1 to the default currency for the customer --- Constraint: must be a valid currency code (e.g. USD) Violation: input value is not a valid currency code Error: 2001/InvalidCurrencyCode ========= Field: currencyCode2 Description: currency code of the Accounts Payable Vendor 2; format: ISO-4217 as supported by www.xe.com Note: if sending an empty string in an update call, reset currencyCode2 to default of null --- Constraint: must be a valid currency code (e.g. USD) Violation: input value is not a valid currency code Error: 2001/InvalidCurrencyCode ========= Field: vendor1Code/vendor2Code Description: valid Accounts Payable Vendor 1/2 ID for this person --- Constraint: max length is 100 Violation: input value is over 100 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength ========= Field: UDF1/UDF2/UDF3 Description: used for additional customer defined fields --- Constraint: max length is 50 Violation: input value is over 50 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength ========= Field: dateFormatMask Description: person's date format preference Note: defaults to "MM/DD/YYYY"; if sending an empty string in an update call, reset dateFormatMask to default --- Constraint: input must match predefined patterns (currently MM/DD/YYYY or DD/MM/YYYY) Violation: input value is not a valid pattern Error: 1001/InvalidPattern ========= Field: currencyMask Description: person's currency preference Note: defaults to "###,###.00"; if sending an empty string in an update call, reset currencyMask to default --- Constraint: input must match predefined patterns (currently ###,###.00 or ###.###,00) Violation: input value is not a valid pattern Error: 1001/InvalidPattern ========= Field: expenseBar Description: person's expense bar preference; value is the expense bar name --- Constraint: required in createPerson call Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: optional in updatePerson call, but must not specify empty string Violation: input value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: must be a valid primary expense bar name setup for the customer Violation: input value is not valid Error: 1000/InvalidInput ========= Field: VATLocation Description: person's country code for VAT purposes --- Constraint: must be a valid country code per ISO 3166 Violation: input value is not a valid country code Error: 2007/InvalidCountryCode ========= Field: interactionUserID/interactionAccountName Description: Interaction CRM integration – Interaction UserID/Account. Leave empty if not using this feature. --- Constraint: max length is 50 Violation: input value is over 50 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength --- Constraint: must be empty/omitted if customer is not setup to use interaction feature Violation: a non-empty value is provided even though customer is not setup to use interaction feature Error: 1007/InvalidOption ========= Field: isAdmin Description: administration module access; defaults to false ========= Field: isCopyingItems Description: Configure copy behavior of previous data from one expense entry to the next to simplify expense entry. Valid entries are: FALSE: Disables copying of Matter, Business Purpose and Transaction Date from the previous line item TRUE: Enables copying of Matter, Business Purpose and Transaction Date from the previous line item Defaults to TRUE. ========= Field: isSuperDelegate Description: user can delegate to full list of users for delegate access; further security restrictions may also be applied; defaults to false ========= Field: useOnline Description: Enables only network search (no cache) for Matter search. Valid entries are: FALSE: Cached search TRUE: Limited network search (no local cache used) Defaults to FALSE. ========= Field: languageCode Description: person's assigned language code Note: defaults to English; if sending an empty string in an update call, reset languageCode to default --- Constraint: must specify a valid language code (per ISO 639-1 (2-letter code) or ISO 639-2 (3-letter code)) Violation: input value is not a valid language code Error: 2002/InvalidLanguageCode ========= Field: alternateCurrencyCodes Description: person's additional currency codes. this is a list type, i.e. multiple values may be sent in one request Note: if sending an empty string in an update call, reset alternateCurrencyCodes to default of null --- Constraint: each currency code provided must be a valid currency code (e.g. USD) Violation: an input value is not a valid currency code Error: 2001/InvalidCurrencyCode ========= Field: alternateEmailAddress1 Description: unique person's alternate email address1. Note: if sending an empty string in an update call, it will delete the email address from tbl_PersonAlternateEmailAddress. If tags are not sent, email address will not be updated. Optional in both createPerson and updatePerson call. --- Constraint: max length is 100 Violation: input value is over 100 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength --- Constraint: must be a valid email address Violation: not a valid email address Error: 1006/InvalidEmail --- Constraint: must be unique, i.e. not conflict with another email address in our database(tbl_Person and tbl_PersonAlternateEmailAddress) Violation: This email address is already used as an alternate email address in the system/This email address is already used as a main email address in the system. Error: 3000/ChoiceUnavailable ========= Field: alternateEmailAddress2 Description: unique person's alternate email address2. Note: if sending an empty string in an update call, it will delete the email address from tbl_PersonAlternateEmailAddress. If tags are not sent, email address will not be updated. Optional in both createPerson and updatePerson call. --- Constraint: max length is 100 Violation: input value is over 100 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength --- Constraint: must be a valid email address Violation: not a valid email address Error: 1006/InvalidEmail --- Constraint: must be unique, i.e. not conflict with another email address in our database(tbl_Person and tbl_PersonAlternateEmailAddress) Violation: This email address is already used as an alternate email address in the system/This email address is already used as a main email address in the system. Error: 3000/ChoiceUnavailable ========= Field: alternateEmailAddress3 Description: unique person's alternate email address3. Note: if sending an empty string in an update call, it will delete the email address from tbl_PersonAlternateEmailAddress. If tags are not sent, email address will not be updated. Optional in both createPerson and updatePerson call. --- Constraint: max length is 100 Violation: input value is over 100 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength --- Constraint: must be a valid email address Violation: not a valid email address Error: 1006/InvalidEmail --- Constraint: must be unique, i.e. not conflict with another email address in our database(tbl_Person and tbl_PersonAlternateEmailAddress) Violation: This email address is already used as an alternate email address in the system/This email address is already used as a main email address in the system. Error: 3000/ChoiceUnavailable ========= Field: analyticsUserType Description: user type for access to the Analytics Reporting tool; Note: Supports Analytics Phase 1 and 2 values. For customers who have used our Person Feed process, note that U99 corresponds to isFirmReporting=true, while NULL corresponds to isFirmReporting=false --- Constraint: required in createPerson call Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: optional in updatePerson call, but if present must be specified together with the analyticsModules and analyticsView fields Violation: the above constraint is not met Error: 1008/InvalidCombination --- Constraint: analyticsUserType U99 is not allowed for the analytics phase 2 or above Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsUserType for the currently enabled analytics phase Error: 1010-01/InvalidanalyticsUserType ========= Constraint: analyticsUserType U01 is only allowed with the analytics phase 2 or above Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsUserType for the currently enabled analytics phase Error: 1010-02/InvalidanalyticsUserType ========= Constraint: analyticsUserType U02 is only allowed with the analytics phase 2 or above Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsUserType for the currently enabled analytics phase Error: 1010-03/InvalidanalyticsUserType ========= Constraint: Valid choices: [NULL, U99, U01, U02, U03, U04] Violation: Invalid analyticsUserType specified Error: 1010/InvalidanalyticsUserType ========= Field: analyticsModules Description: modules configuration for access to the Analytics Reporting tool Note: Supports Analytics Phase 1 and 2 values --- Constraint: required in createPerson call Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: optional in updatePerson call, but if present must be specified together with the analyticsUserType and analyticsView fields Violation: the above constraint is not met Error: 1008/InvalidCombination --- Constraint: analyticsModules must be NULL for the analytics phase 1 Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the currently enabled analytics phase Error: 1011-01/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules can not be NULL for the analytics phase 2 or above Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the currently enabled analytics phase Error: 1011-02/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M01, following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-03/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules M01 is not valid with INVOICE-Only Subscription. Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-04/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M02, following subscriptions are required - INVOICE Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-05/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M03, following subscriptions are required - AUDIT Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-07/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules M03 is not valid with INVOICE-Only Subscription. Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-08/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M04, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE and AUDIT (No EXPENSE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-09/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M04, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE and AUDIT (No AUDIT Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-10/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules M04 is not valid with INVOICE-Only Subscription. Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-11/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M05, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE and INVOICE (No EXPENSE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-12/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M05, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE and INVOICE (No INVOICE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-13/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules M05 is not valid with INVOICE-Only Subscription. Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-14/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M06, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE and AUDIT (No EXPENSE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-15/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M06, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE and AUDIT (No INVOICE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-16/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M06, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE and AUDIT (No AUDIT Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-17/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules M06 is not valid with INVOICE-Only Subscription Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions. Error: 1011-18/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M07, following subscriptions are required - INVOICE and PO (No INVOICE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-19/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M07, following subscriptions are required - INVOICE and PO (No PO Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-20/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M08, following subscriptions are required - INVOICE and PO (No INVOICE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-21/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M08, following subscriptions are required - INVOICE and PO (No PO Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-22/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M09, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE and PO(No EXPENSE Subscription). Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-23/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M09, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE and PO(No INVOICE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-24/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules M09 is not valid with INVOICE-Only Subscription. Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-25/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules M09 is not valid with EXPENSE, INVOICE and PO (No PO Subscription). Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-26/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M10, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE, PO and AUDIT(No EXPENSE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-27/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M10, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE, PO and AUDIT(No INVOICE Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-28/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M10, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE, PO and AUDIT(No AUDIT Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-29/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: analyticsModules M10 is not valid with INVOICE-Only Subscription Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions. Error: 1011-30/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: For analyticsModules M10, the following subscriptions are required - EXPENSE, INVOICE, PO and AUDIT(No PO Subscription) Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsModules for the configured subscriptions Error: 1011-31/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Constraint: Valid choices: [NULL, M01, M02, M03, M04, M05, M06, M07, M08, M09, M10] Violation: Invalid analyticsModules specified Error: 1011/InvalidAnalyticsModules ========= Field: analyticsView Description: view configuration for access to the Analytics Reporting tool Note: Supports Analytics Phase 1 and 2 values --- Constraint: required in createPerson call Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: optional in updatePerson call, but if present must be specified together with the analyticsUserType and analyticsModules fields Violation: the above constraint is not met Error: 1008/InvalidCombination --- Constraint: analyticsView must be NULL for the analytics phase 1 Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsView for the currently enabled analytics phase Error: 1012-01/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView can not be NULL for the analytics phase 2 or above Violation: Invalid value of the field analyticsView for the currently enabled analytics phase Error: 1012-02/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V01 is only valid with analyticsUserType U01 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsUserType in the request Error: 1012-03/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V01 is not valid with analyticsModules M02, M03, M07 or M08 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsModules in the request Error: 1012-04/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V02 is only valid with analyticsUserType U01 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsUserType in the request Error: 1012-05/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V03 is only valid with analyticsUserType U01 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsUserType in the request Error: 1012-06/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V04 is only valid with analyticsUserType U01 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsUserType in the request Error: 1012-07/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V04 is not valid with analyticsModules M02, M03, M07 or M08 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsModules in the request Error: 1012-08/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V05 is only valid with analyticsUserType U01 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsUserType in the request Error: 1012-09/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V06 is only valid with analyticsUserType U01 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsUserType in the request Error: 1012-10/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V06 is not valid with analyticsModules M02, M03, M07 or M08 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsModules in the request Error: 1012-11/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V07 is only valid with analyticsUserType U02 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsUserType in the request Error: 1012-12/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V07 is not valid with analyticsModules M02, M03, M07 or M08 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsModules in the request Error: 1012-13/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V09 is only valid with analyticsUserType U02 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsUserType in the request Error: 1012-17/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: analyticsView V09 is only valid with analyticsModules M02, M03, M07 or M08 Violation: Invalid combination of analyticsView and analyticsModules in the request Error: 1012-18/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Constraint: Valid choices: [NULL, V01, V02, V03, V04, V05, V06, V07, V08, V09, V10] Violation: Invalid analyticsView specified Error: 1012/InvalidAnalyticsView ========= Field: defaultApplication Description: person's attribute for application. --- Constraint: Valid choices: [NULL, 1, 2] Violation: input value does not refer to the valid values Error: 1007/InvalidOption =========
Here are the parameters of the input Entity object for the addEntity and removeEntity operations and associated validation rules.
========= Field: customerUniqueID Description: person's unique record identifier. --- Constraint: must refer to an existing person Violation: input value does not refer to an existing person Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField ========= Field: roleName Description: the name of the role for the person-entity relationship being updated --- Constraint: must refer to a valid role Violation: input value does not refer to a valid role Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField ========= Field: entityTypeCode Description: the entity type code for the person-entity relationship being updated --- Constraint: must be a valid entity type code Violation: input value does not refer to a valid entity type Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField ========= Field: entityCode Description: the entity code for the person-entity relationship being updated --- Constraint: must refer to a valid entity under the input entity type Violation: input value does not refer to a valid entity Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: in a removeEntity call, must refer to an existing person-entity relationship for the person being updated Violation: entity not currently part of a person-entity relationship for the person being updated Error: 501/ObjectMissing
Here are the validation rules performed in a call to the getPersonDetails operation.
========= Input: customerUniqueId Description: person's unique record identifier. --- Constraint: must refer to an existing person Violation: input value does not refer to an existing person Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField
Here are the parameters of the input PersonDelegate object for the addPersonDelegate, deletePersonDelegate operation and associated validation rules.
========= Field: fromCustomerUniqueID Description: person's unique record identifier. --- Constraint: must refer to an existing person Violation: input value does not refer to an existing person Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField ========= Field: toCustomerUniqueID Description: person's unique record identifier. --- Constraint: must refer to an existing person Violation: input value does not refer to an existing person Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField ========= For more information about this and other Chrome River Web Services, please contact us at support@chromeriver.com.</wsdl:documentation> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="unqualified" targetNamespace="http://person.ws.chromeriver.com/" <wsdl:definitions name="LoginService" targetNamespace="http://login.ws.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:ns1="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:tns="http://login.ws.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <wsdl:documentation>The Chrome River Login Web Service fulfills requests from our customers to log in to our Web Services platform.
To get started with Chrome River Web Services, please submit a Chrome River Help Desk ticket. Our Implementation team will work with you to get everything set up and running.
To access this service, use this Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file to generate the required client proxy classes: https://api.chromeriver.com/ws_LoginV1?wsdl
Please also read this documentation to understand what it does and how to properly prepare requests.
Logging In
Each request to access a Chrome River Web Service must be authenticated via either login credentials or a session token. The Login Web Service may be used to submit the user's login information in a request consisting of companyID, userID, and password. The user will receive a token to submit with subsequent requests to other Chrome River Web Services, eliminating the need to provide the login information again.
While it is also possible to submit login information directly via the header of every Chrome River Web Service, it is recommended that customers use the Login Web Service first to obtain a session token, and then submit this token in each subsequent request to the other services.
Chrome River Login Web Service Overview
Only one operation is exposed via the Login Web Service: createSession. The purpose of this operation is to submit login credentials and get in response a session token used to access other Chrome River Web Services. The token will renew each time it is used in a request. It will expire after 30 minutes of inactivity, at which point a new token must be acquired by resubmitting the login credentials to this service.
Each call to the createSession operation requires the LoginCredentials input object, which contains two parameters: token and user. This object is actually a shared input across all Chrome River Web Services. In services other than the Login Service, the token parameter is used to submit the session ID along with the rest of the request. In the Login Service, use the user parameter to set the required login credentials: companyID, userID, and password.
The service responds to a request with the MessageEnvelope object. In the event of a successful outcome, the envelope will contain the statusCode "ReturnStatusCode.SUCCESS," along with a session token in the sessionID field. In the event of a failed outcome, the envelope will contain the statusCode "ReturnStatusCode.FAIL," along with a list of ValidationError objects detailing why the request was not successful. Each ValidationError contains three pieces of information: the error code, the name of the error code, and a brief message explaining the error.
In the Login Service there are two possible error scenarios:
1. Invalid Login ===================== Description: The credentials provided do not match a valid record in our system. Error Code: 9000 Error Name: InvalidLogin Error Message: Invalid login information Resolution: Double-check that the companyID, userID, and password match those provided to you previously by Chrome River.
2. Invalid Session ===================== Description: The token provided is not valid or has expired. Error Code: 9001 Error Name: InvalidSession Error Message: No session, or session no longer valid. Resolution: Log in again with full credentials to obtain a new and valid session token.
For more information about this and other Chrome River Web Services, please contact us at support@chromeriver.com.</wsdl:documentation> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="unqualified" targetNamespace="http://login.ws.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:complexType name="loginCredentials"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="token" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="user" type="tns:userLoginInfo"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="userLoginInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="companyId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="userId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="password" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="MessageEnvelope"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="statusCode" type="tns:returnStatusCode"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sessionId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="validationError" type="tns:ValidationError"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="webServicePayload" type="tns:Payload"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ValidationError"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="name" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="message" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Payload"> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="returnStatusCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="FAIL"/> <xs:enumeration value="SUCCESS"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:element name="loginCredentials" nillable="true" type="tns:loginCredentials"/> <xs:element name="createSessionResponse" nillable="true" type="tns:MessageEnvelope"/> </xs:schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:message name="createSessionResponse"> <wsdl:part element="tns:createSessionResponse" name="createSessionResponse"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="createSession"> <wsdl:part element="tns:loginCredentials" name="loginCredentials"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:portType name="Login"> <wsdl:operation name="createSession"> <wsdl:input message="tns:createSession" name="createSession"></wsdl:input> <wsdl:output message="tns:createSessionResponse" name="createSessionResponse"></wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:portType> <wsdl:binding name="LoginServiceSoapBinding" type="tns:Login"> <soap:binding style="document" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="createSession"> <soap:operation soapAction="" style="document"/> <wsdl:input name="createSession"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="createSessionResponse"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:binding> <wsdl:service name="LoginService"> <wsdl:port binding="tns:LoginServiceSoapBinding" name="LoginPort"> <soap:address location="https://staging-api.chromeriver.com/ws_LoginV1"/> </wsdl:port> </wsdl:service> </wsdl:definitions>
